Beta Updates

This is the first update and will be unused.

Beta Updates

This is largely a tweaked UI update and a beta update test.
We've added some links to our help pages to explain how keyboard shortcuts, macOS permissions, and the push-to-talk feature work.
Updated the default shortcut key to Command + Shift + M.

Fixed a bug when unmuting in Zoom, Skype, and Microsoft Teams that would cause some users to have a very low microphone volume for a second or so after unmuting. If you unmuted yourself but others could barely hear you, chances are this was the issue. Fortunately: we‚Äôve totally fixed it.

Fixed a really rare bug with the keyboard shortcut recorder that could cause the app to crash.

Updated the menu bar icon and our app icon.

Added a ‚ÄúCheck for updates‚Äù action in the menu bar, for users who want to manually update Mic Drop (or accidentally dismissed an update notification and don't want to wait a day for the update check to run again).

0.13.1

Adjusted the microphone icon size in the menu bar and preferences drop-down.

0.13.0

Fixed a really rare bug with the keyboard shortcut recorder that could cause the app to crash.

Updated the menu bar icon and our app icon.

Added a ‚ÄúCheck for updates‚Äù action in the menu bar, for users who want to manually update Mic Drop (or accidentally dismissed an update notification and don't want to wait a day for the update check to run again).

Mic Drop is out of beta!

Thanks so much to all the beta testers who submitted feature requests, bug reports, and valuable feedback over the course of our beta period. We really appreciate it and we hope you like the final version of the app.

This version is the same version that's available on getmicdrop.com, so comes with licensing in the app. But don't worry: as a thank you to each-and-every beta tester we've emailed you a coupon for a free copy of Mic Drop. Just click "Buy" in the app and make sure to enter the coupon code we emailed you earlier‚Äîit will let you get a free, lifetime license of Mic Drop.

We hope that, even in these wild times, at least your meetings are a bit calmer thanks to Mic Drop.

‚ù§Ô∏è and üêô, from Sarah and Matt from Octopus Think

We squashed a few annoying bugs.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed layering for the license window. If you tried to launch/purchase Mic Drop but the license window disappeared underneath all of your other windows: sorry! We fixed that.
  • Fixed an issue with the Fulla 3 Headphone Amp. If have a Schiit Audio Fulla 3 plugged into your Mac, muting with Mic Drop would lag. Looks like there are select audio devices that are problematic to mute. For now, the Schiit Fulla 3 will not be muted by Mic Drop. We're looking into better fixes for future releases.

We hope Mic Drop is making your meetings better, and we'd love it if you shared Mic Drop with your friends or coworkers. getmicdrop.com is the website to share if you know anyone else spending a lot of time in meetings. üôÇ

‚ù§Ô∏è and üêô, from Sarah and Matt from Octopus Think

This release is mostly a few wee bugfixes:

  • You can now use a function keys (F5, F11) as your shortcut.
  • You can now unassign the keyboard shortcut altogether, if you don't want to use one.
  • If you have a Schiit Audio Fulla 3 headphone amp, it should now work better with Mic Drop.
  • The license window behaves better now.

We hope Mic Drop is making your meetings better, and we'd love it if you shared Mic Drop with your friends or coworkers. getmicdrop.com is the website to share if you know anyone else spending a lot of time in meetings. üôÇ

Just one fix in this release, but it's a good one!

  • New: We fixed a crash that could happen in rare cases, mostly when adding/removing/switching audio devices. (Apologies for that one!)
  • You can now use a function keys (F5, F11) as your shortcut.
  • You can now unassign the keyboard shortcut altogether, if you don't want to use one.

We hope Mic Drop is making your meetings better, and we'd love it if you shared Mic Drop with your friends or coworkers. getmicdrop.com is the website to share if you know anyone else spending a lot of time in meetings. üôÇ

If you have any questions or feature requests, send us an email or tweet at @octopusthink.

Oh hello there! We added a new feature to Mic Drop: a floating, draggable status window. (Special thanks to Enrique for the idea & feedback!)

  • New: Added a floating window as a more prominent status indicator. You can drag this window anywhere on your screen. It's also clickable, so you can use it to toggle your microphone.
  • Fix: Some audio devices can't be muted by macOS, so we can't mute them in Mic Drop. We now detect incompatible devices & send you a notification.
  • Fix: Some users reported high CPU usage when using Loopback, BlackHole, or another loopback audio device. We've fixed that in this release, so you can enjoy the serenity of a quiet fan.

We hope Mic Drop is making your meetings better, and we'd love it if you shared Mic Drop with your friends or coworkers. Send them to getmicdrop.com if they're spending a lot of time in meetings. üôÇ

Big Sur and Apple Silicon Update

Mic Drop has a new icon for Big Sur and we're all set for Apple Silicon!

Mic Drop is now a Universal Binary, running natively on Intel and M1 Macs.

We also fixed a bug in macOS Big Sur that could cause the status window to resize/reposition itself when toggled, along with some font-sizing and layout bugs in macOS Big Sur.

(Mic Drop still works fine with macOS 10.15 Catalina, if you haven't yet upgraded!)

Some accessibility fixes for VoiceOver users:

  • Improved support for VoiceOver by improving the text in the menubar item.
  • Fixed a bug that caused a crash when activating Mic Drop's menubar item using VoiceOver.

This release includes some under-the-hood improvements to make Mic Drop consume fewer resources and includes some UI fixes for users of macOS 12 Monterey.

We also fixed a rare crash that could happen after you activated your Mic Drop license. If you encountered that: we're very sorry and it should now be fixed!

You can use your Bluetooth headphones with Mic Drop again! üéâ¬†Also, visual notifications help you know when you're muted.

‚ú®¬†New: Visual notifications! Now it's easier to tell when you've toggled the mute. Notifications are off by default, but you can enable them in Preferences.
